waypoints.title: The CMZ
waypoints.description: The Central Molecular Zone seen with MEERKAT and Spitzer.  Color composite by Ashley Barnes.

waypoints.title: ACES
waypoints.description: The ALMA Central Molecular Zone survey (ACES) combined with the Green Bank Telescope's MUSTANG survey in the Galactic Center.  This is the highest-resolution millimeter image produced of the Galactic Center.

waypoints.title: Nonhebel bubble
waypoints.description: The Nonhebel bubble is a large, expanding bubble of gas and dust in the Galactic Center.  It may be the result of supernovae.

waypoints.title: Sgr B2 with ALMA
waypoints.description:
The Sgr B2 cloud is our Galaxy's most massive and active star-forming region.  It contains several high-mass protoclusters, Sgr B2 N and M, and a third that's a bit smaller, S. 
  This image shows the ACES view of Sgr B2 with ALMA.

waypoints.title: Sgr B2 with ALMA
waypoints.description:
The Sgr B2 cloud is our Galaxy's most massive and active star-forming region.  It contains several high-mass protoclusters, Sgr B2 N and M, and a third that's a bit smaller, S. 
  This image shows the medium-resolution view of Sgr B2 with ALMA from Ginsburg+ 2018.

waypoints.title: Sgr B2N
waypoints.description:
Sagittarius B2 North is the most massive site of ongoing star formation in the Milky Way.  Within a region less than a tenth of a parsec across, thousands of solar masses of gas are flowing into a central massive-star-forming protocluster birthing several proto-O-stars within only a few thousand astronomical units.  
 Data by Nazar Budaiev.

waypoints.title: Sgr B2M
waypoints.description:
Sgr B2M is the most massive embedded star cluster in the Galactic Center.  The image shows several HII regions, sites where massive stars have ionized their surroundings, within a tiny volume.   
 Data by Nazar Budaiev.

waypoints.title: The CMZ
waypoints.description: The Central Molecular Zone seen with MEERKAT and Spitzer.  Color composite by Ashley Barnes.

  This image shows the medium-resolution view of Sgr B2 with ALMA from Ginsburg+ 2018.

Within a region less than a tenth of a parsec across, thousands of solar masses of gas are flowing into a central massive-star-forming protocluster birthing several proto-O-stars within only a few thousand astronomical units.

 Data by Nazar Budaiev.

waypoints.title: CH₃CHO: Acetaldehyde
waypoints.description: Acetaldehyde (CH₃CHO) is a complex organic molecule that traces warm, dense gas in star-forming regions. Its emission reveals sites of active chemistry and heating in the CMZ.

waypoints.title: CS 2-1: Carbon Monosulfide
waypoints.description: Carbon monosulfide (CS) is an excellent tracer of dense molecular gas. The 2-1 transition reveals the distribution of moderately high-density regions throughout the ACES field.

waypoints.title: H¹³CN: Hydrogen Cyanide Isotopologue
waypoints.description: H¹³CN is a rare isotopologue of hydrogen cyanide that traces dense molecular gas without becoming optically thick, providing crucial measurements of gas column density.

waypoints.title: H¹³CO⁺: Formyl Ion Isotopologue
waypoints.description: H¹³CO⁺ traces molecular gas.

waypoints.title: H40α: Hydrogen Recombination Line
waypoints.description: The H40α recombination line traces ionized hydrogen around hot, massive stars.

waypoints.title: HC¹⁵N: Cyanopolyyne
waypoints.description: HC¹⁵N contains the rare nitrogen-15 isotope. This isotopologue traces dense molecular gas without becoming optically thick.

waypoints.title: HC₃N: Cyanoacetylene
waypoints.description: Cyanoacetylene (HC₃N) is a carbon-chain molecule that traces cold molecular gas and is abundant in quiescent regions of molecular clouds.

waypoints.title: HCO⁺: Formyl Ion
waypoints.description: HCO⁺ is one of the most important tracers of molecular gas. Its emission reveals the structure and kinematics of dense gas throughout the CMZ.

waypoints.title: HCO⁺: Mopra Single-Dish
waypoints.description: HCO⁺ feathered with Mopra telescope data provides large-scale structure context for the ALMA observations, showing the full extent of molecular gas.

waypoints.title: HCO⁺: Interferometer Only
waypoints.description: HCO⁺ without total power data shows only the compact structures resolved by ALMA's interferometer, revealing the small-scale structure of dense cores.

waypoints.title: HN¹³C: Hydrogen Isocyanide Isotopologue
waypoints.description: HN¹³C, an isotopologue of hydrogen isocyanide, traces dense gas at lower optical depth than the more common isotopologue.

waypoints.title: HNCO: Isocyanic Acid
waypoints.description: HNCO traces molecular gas and is often enhanced in shocked regions.

waypoints.title: NS⁺: Nitrogen Sulfide Ion
waypoints.description: NS⁺ is a rare molecular ion that traces regions with active ion-molecule chemistry, providing insights into the chemical networks operating in the CMZ.

waypoints.title: SiO 2-1: Silicon Monoxide
waypoints.description: SiO is a shock tracer that highlights regions where high-velocity gas collisions have liberated silicon from dust grains, revealing outflows and cloud collisions.

waypoints.title: SO 2₁-1₀: Sulfur Monoxide
waypoints.description: SO traces moderately dense gas and is often enhanced in shocked regions and outflows, complementing SiO.

waypoints.title: SO 3₂-2₁: Sulfur Monoxide
waypoints.description: The SO 3₂-2₁ transition traces roughly the same gas as SO 2₁-1₀, providing information about temperature and density variations in shocked regions.
